nodes.label: Larry Visoski
nodes.role: Personal pilot — testified at Maxwell trial

nodes.label: Juan Alessi
nodes.role: House manager — testified at Maxwell trial

nodes.label: Audrey Strauss
nodes.role: Acting U.S. Attorney — announced Maxwell arrest

edges.document_title: United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell — Indictment (20 Cr. 330)
edges.quote_snippet: Ghislaine Maxwell assisted, facilitated, and contributed to Jeffrey Epstein's abuse of minor girls by, among other things, helping Epstein to recruit, groom, and ultimately abuse victims known to Maxwell and Epstein to be under the age of eighteen.

edges.document_title: United States v. Epstein — Non-Prosecution Agreement (2007)
edges.quote_snippet: Sarah Kellen named as potential co-conspirator in the Non-Prosecution Agreement between the United States and Jeffrey Epstein.

edges.document_title: United States v. Epstein — Non-Prosecution Agreement (2007)
edges.quote_snippet: Nadia Marcinkova identified as potential co-conspirator in the Non-Prosecution Agreement.

edges.document_title: United States v. Epstein — Non-Prosecution Agreement (2007)
edges.quote_snippet: Lesley Groff named as potential co-conspirator in the Non-Prosecution Agreement between the United States and Jeffrey Epstein.

edges.document_title: United States v. Epstein — Non-Prosecution Agreement (2007)
edges.quote_snippet: Adriana Ross named as potential co-conspirator in the Non-Prosecution Agreement.

edges.document_title: United States v. Maxwell — Trial Testimony Records
edges.quote_snippet: Jean-Luc Brunel referenced in testimony as associate who provided access to young models through MC2 modeling agency.

edges.document_title: United States v. Maxwell — Trial Transcript, Testimony of Larry Visoski
edges.quote_snippet: Larry Visoski testified he served as Epstein's personal pilot for approximately 25 years, flying Epstein on his private aircraft.

edges.document_title: United States v. Maxwell — Government Exhibit: Flight Logs
edges.quote_snippet: David Rodgers maintained handwritten flight logs for Epstein's aircraft, entered as Government Exhibit at the Maxwell trial.

edges.document_title: United States v. Maxwell — Trial Transcript, Testimony of Juan Alessi
edges.quote_snippet: Juan Alessi testified he worked as house manager at Epstein's Palm Beach residence for approximately eleven years.

edges.document_title: SDFL Case Records — Alfredo Rodriguez Obstruction Case
edges.quote_snippet: Alfredo Rodriguez, a former house manager for Epstein, was convicted of obstruction of justice for attempting to sell Epstein's personal phone directory.

edges.document_title: United States v. Maxwell — Trial Transcript, Testimony of Haley Robson
edges.quote_snippet: Haley Robson testified about being recruited and subsequently recruiting other girls to provide massages at Epstein's Palm Beach residence.

edges.document_title: United States v. Maxwell — Superseding Indictment (S2 20 Cr. 330)
edges.quote_snippet: Virginia Giuffre identified in court filings as a victim recruited by Ghislaine Maxwell for Jeffrey Epstein beginning around 1999-2000.

edges.document_title: United States v. Maxwell — Superseding Indictment (S2 20 Cr. 330)
edges.quote_snippet: Maria Farmer identified as a victim who reported abuse by Epstein and Maxwell to the FBI in 1996.

edges.document_title: United States v. Maxwell — Trial Transcript, Testimony of Annie Farmer
edges.quote_snippet: Annie Farmer testified that Maxwell and Epstein sexually abused her when she was sixteen years old during a visit to Epstein's New Mexico ranch.

edges.document_title: Ransome v. Maxwell — Civil Complaint (SDNY)
edges.quote_snippet: Sarah Ransome filed a civil suit detailing allegations of sexual abuse by Epstein on his private island.

edges.document_title: SDNY Victim Impact Statements — Jennifer Araoz
edges.quote_snippet: Jennifer Araoz submitted a victim impact statement to the court describing abuse by Epstein beginning when she was fourteen years old.

edges.document_title: Doe v. United States — CVRA Litigation (SDFL)
edges.quote_snippet: Attorney Bradley Edwards filed a Crime Victims' Rights Act suit challenging the Epstein Non-Prosecution Agreement on behalf of victims.

edges.document_title: DOJ OPR Review — Epstein Non-Prosecution Agreement
edges.quote_snippet: AUSA Marie Villafana handled the original federal investigation and negotiation of the Non-Prosecution Agreement with Epstein's counsel.

edges.document_title: United States v. Maxwell — Case Docket, Prosecution Team
edges.quote_snippet: AUSA Maurene Comey served as a member of the prosecution team in United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.

edges.document_title: DOJ Press Release — Maxwell Arrest Announcement
edges.quote_snippet: Acting United States Attorney Audrey Strauss announced the arrest and indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell for conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors.

edges.document_title: United States v. Maxwell — Indictment
edges.quote_snippet: Sarah Kellen referenced in Maxwell indictment as an associate who assisted in scheduling victims for Epstein.

edges.document_title: United States v. Maxwell — Superseding Indictment
edges.quote_snippet: Maxwell recruited and groomed Virginia Giuffre for sexual abuse by Epstein.

edges.document_title: United States v. Maxwell — Trial Transcript, Testimony of Juan Alessi
edges.quote_snippet: Alessi testified that Maxwell directed household operations and managed access to Epstein's Palm Beach residence.

edges.document_title: Court filings referencing Jean-Luc Brunel
edges.quote_snippet: Virginia Giuffre alleged in court filings that Brunel provided young girls to Epstein through his modeling agency.

edges.document_title: Government Exhibit — Flight Logs
edges.quote_snippet: Both Larry Visoski and David Rodgers identified in flight logs as pilots of Epstein's aircraft.
